name: LEGO® Jurassic World
description: Following the epic storylines of Jurassic Park, The Lost World: Jurassic Park and Jurassic Park III, as well as the highly anticipated Jurassic World, LEGO Jurassic World™ is the first videogame where players will be able to relive and experience all four Jurassic films.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows®XP SP3, Windows Vista/7/8 with latest service packs and updates installed Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo or equivalent AMD dual core CPU Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 7600GS or ATI Radeon 1950, 256 Mb RAM DirectX: Version 10 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 10 GB available space Additional Notes: Windows XP and DirectX® 9.0b and below not supported
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/7/8 Processor: Intel i5, 4 x 2.6 GHz or AMD equivalent Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 480 or ATI Radeon HD 5850 or better, 1Gb RAM DirectX: Version 11 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 10 GB available space Additional Notes: Windows XP and DirectX® 9.0b and below not supported

reviews.review_text: You stood on the shoulders of geniuses to accomplish something as fast as you could, and before you even knew what you had, you patented it, and packaged it, and slapped it on a plastic game case, and now you're selling it, you wanna sell it. Well... its not half bad, very well done, they spared no expense!

here's my experience in the newest game of LEGO series: -If you already watched the movie (Jurassic park and Jurassic world) -Then play and enjoy the game (just smash and destroy everything in your sight) -Discover some magnificent places and badass dinosaurs (you can create your own dinosaur too) -Suddenly i heard  this  -All childhood memories came back in my head -Goosebumps all over my body -Cried a lot ( ･ᴗ･̥̥̥ ) 10/10 best dinosaurs and LEGO game for me

This game is honestly my favourite LEGO game. It is great at staying true to the story and making it funny at the same time. There is a small glitch that you will encounter early in the game. It occurs when you press the charge button on the triceratops, it closes the game without any report. I had this and it made my sad that I couldn't play it. You can fix the glitch by following these instructions. Locate your roaming folder (Which can be done by typing %appdata% into run). Then go to Warner Bros. Interactive entertainment. Click LEGO Jurassic world and delete pcconfig.txt
Lego Jeff Goldblum's Laugh 420/360

Got this game for my 5 year old son, over the course of 20ish weeks we played 30 hours+/- and boy we had alot of fun together.  He solves the puzzles and I tag along until it gets hard or tricky and he asks me to help a bit.  I recommend this game if you are looking for a game to play with one of your kids.  (I have a high end gaming rig, no idea how the game runs for other people but I never had any problems with it.)

This is one of my favorite lego games of all time. Got to relive all Jurassic Park 1, 2 , 3 and Jurassic World  I would recommend for those who havent watched the Jurassic World movie to watch it first before you play that section of the game because, it follows the events that happened in the lego game. One down side is the co-op screen when set to 'dynamic' sometimes messes around with the screen and gets disoriented on which charcter am I playing. Above all great game! I played local co-op to finish the game and looking forward to make it 100%. Would love to see a Workshop edition come to the game with extra maps and puzzles  10/10
O_O I LOVE THIS GAME!! I am a jurassic park fan myself...well...of the series..this game is AWESOME!!!

Really cool game. It has the lego humor the lego Star Wars had. Really enjoyable and well turned. Controls with a keyboard aren't very good, but one quickly gets the hang of it. So far my favortite Lego game since Star Wars. I recommend!

Brillient game to start with, mine runs pretty smooth but i am now stuck at a part as the game does not run like it should!   When feeding the raptors, once the cow is on the cage, the claxon sounds and wakes up the crane driver, he should fall off and release a target however mine doesnt and i know someone else who has this problem. Ive tried messing with the graphics, starting and restarting the level but to no avail.  Could anyone help! I love this game so far but am really disappointed now as i cant continue :(   Any advice woud be helpful!

It is a okay game. I recommend it, but you have to know that its the same old Lego formula with no innovation whatsoever.  Pros:  + runs super smooth + great controller layout + pretty lenghty game (a little bit too stretched out at times) + easy to understand even for younger kids + beautiful graphics + love for detail, the world is filled with easter eggs and little nods to the Jurassic Park universe + local coop + all Jurassic Park movies were recreated + various characters that have different abilities, even the smallest staff member is in here + they didnt just recreate scenes from the movies, they actually thought out clever new levels, sceneres and additional paths for the heroes to go through, along with a faithful Lego recreation of the beloved movies + in the german dub, many voice actors from the original movie reprised their roles, which is fantastic + Nvidia 3D TV Play looks awesome. Like its meant to be played in stereoscopic 3D (even cutscenes are 3D) + create-your-own-dinosaur + replayability if you want all the characters and collectibles  Cons:  - unfortunatley its the same old formula that is being used for EVERY Lego game, destroy everything, pick up coins, build something to unlock new path and repeat, it gets old pretty fast. I was disappointed to see that they didnt even try something new - picking up coins is a chore, its not particulary neccessary but you still kinda want to see what you can unlock, picking coins up stretches the games lenght by a lot and is just tedious - breaking all the stuff breaks immersion a little bit, a character is in danger and you gotta hurry, but instead you search slowly through the level what to break to get all the coins.....it slows down the games action scenes by a lot - coop partners still can hurt each  other.....why?  there is no reason why you could hit each other in these type of games. Especially when you are playing with a younger kid that smashes the punch button to break all the blocks in the level, comboing the partner to death....its not really coop friendly - they approached a new open world feel, but ultimatley I whished they would have gone back to a simple level select screen, its tedious to get to the next location and its not clear where you can buy or unlock new things - the DLCs are terrible! Absolutley cosmetic, but the text makes you belive you get to be a tourist in Jurassic World, but its just a usless skin, the same goes for vehicles, every car feels the same  Overall its a Lego game. Can be fun in coop and looks beautiful. Personally I get tired of the same game with different license, but if you like that definitley get this one too. Its faithful to the movies and universe. A fun ride to enjoy.

This is a fun game. It is the first, of many, LEGO games I bought on Steam, and the second game I got on Steam, the first game I got was Coffee Stain Studios' Goat Simulator. If you are either a LEGO fan, Jurassic Park/World fan, or a dinofanatic, this is the game for you. I had so many fun hours filled with pretty great characters and dinosaurs from all of the 4 films, even SPOILER ALERT: Steven Spielberg and Mr. DNA, from the first film, and the fourth film as a cameo and all 2 of the islands: Isla Nublar, Jurassic Park and Jurassic World variations, and Isla Sorna, The Lost World: Jurassic Park and Jurassic Park III variations, all packed in ones huge game. If you want to play a good game that has replayabilty after you complete the campaign, I recommend this to you.
The Park is open   9.5/10 i love this game

I have only played a little, little bit, but for the people that were saying that their controllers did not work easily, mine worked absolutly flawlessly, no setup required (besides drivers). I have two xbox one controllers that I am using if that helps. I just wanted to even out the reviews that said it was broken for them.

In this game can play anyone, not just fans of LEGO or Jurassic Park. During the game you can listen to the soundtrack of films introduced in many situations. As in other lego games, you can find here a huge sense of humour in cutscenes, but also during the game. To the extra quests we can use about four separate maps, created by creators. Apart form and vehicles can also control the dinosaurs - it's epic. Cons: Even great races become boring with time. It's too many of them. Also we have surfeit of characters, such assecurity guard supervisor worker; Mr DNA - seriously? 9/10
I recommend you play Jurassic Park in this game first.Just for sequential order.

Another good lego game with cool characters, levels and storyline. The first lego game I have played on a keyboard (as I played all the others on the Xbox 360), but configured the buttons to my liking. Though I felt the game was a bit short, finding all the collectables adds onto the amount of playability. I heard there were some glitches in the game, but luckily I played through the whole game without any problems and still haven't found any after completing it (maybe they fixed them?)   One thing I wish would be added in lego games is the ability for online co-op, as I personally think this would be a great feature for friends who own the game and want to play co-op from the comfort of their own homes.  Overall a great game, the humor was good, the dialogue was interesting and the fact they added in audio from the films makes it that bit better, and was a bargain considering I bought it when it was £18.50 on sale. A definite must have for all lego fans! A neat 9.5/10, the .5 being the game feeling a bit short, but a definite must-buy otherwise.  *EDIT* Completed the game to 100% and I only found 1 issue, which was during the bonus level where you chase the gyrosphere as the I-REX, the dino spawned at the end of the level instead of behind the gyrosphere (which is what is supposed to happen). Also for people struggling to find the last gold brick, I found my last one in JP1 in the dilophosauras pen, which there are 3 acid fruits on trees you have to shoot/spit down. For some reason, even before I finally found the brick all the map hubs said I had full bricks on each one so try there first if you are struggling.

This Game Is AWESOME!!!!You Can Use All Characters Of Jurassic Park Trilogy!All Music,Effects,Dinosaurs,The Whole Game,Is Exactly Like Movies.....It Is A Relax Funny Game,And I Recommended To Everyone Who Want To Spend His Time,For This Trip....The Only Thing That I Hate,It Was The Split Screen,Which It's Really Annoying If Someone Wants To Play With Two Characters....By The Way,I'm Very Happy About This Game.....Welcome To Jurassic Universe
it's a good game in all if you have $40 dollars i recommend buying it but be warned i beat all 3 jurasic parks in 9 hours not much time i'd say it would actually take about 2 days but it didn't

Having complete this game literally 100%, it has been hilariously fun, and worth every dollar.  Only things I have to say are bad, and this is extereme nit picking, are the following.   The voices of the main characters are just clips from the movies. So they dont sound as clear or crisp as you would hope.   Also, even though they had to change some scenes to make this game kid friendly (which is understandable) they slightly moved around some scenes. For example, the scene when the kids meet Hammond on the stairs is moved from inside the Centre, to the Raptor cage; which being a big fan of the franchise kinda kinda peeved me off a little.  Ran into a bug where after the T-Rex paddock scene, my game went into a loading screen halfway through the cutscene, while the cutscene was still going, and just stayed like that for awhile; the solution being to get Steam to verify the game cache.   Though I am nit picking EXTREMELY hard; those are the only things wrong I had found.  Definately worth playing if you are a huge fan of th Jurassic Park series, LEGO, a kid or young at heart.
You can be Raptor Raptor can build  420/10 must buy

Using charge attacks as a dinosaur crashes the game, which is needed to advance the story and complete levels.  Camera spazzes out sometimes zooming in really close to character making it difficult to see or play.  Movie dialogue seems out of place when it is used alongside new voice acting which drowns out the movie dialogue as it is several times louder.  Intro's are loading screens forcing you to watch the same sequence every single time you launch the game.  Floor disappeared causing to fall into oblivion and having to restart the level.
Just started playing but already loving it! Cant wait til im finished with Jurassic Park and move on to Jurassic World! I can see many hours being spent on this game.

I can finally live out my autistic fantasies of velociraptors with stego backplates and triceratop horns and frill working with Robert Muldoon to make a better tomorrow. The perfect game has finally descended upon us.

Though I love Jurassic Park, it's impossible to recommend this game considering how absolutely broken it is. The first issue came when I couldn't even enter the main menu due to the game not registering any keys or mouse clicks to enter. After ctrl-alt-deleting to exit and then restarting the game, it allowed me to enter. From this point on EVERY one of the dozen or so times I tried to start the game required a failed attempt into a restart to be able to play.   Once I got into the game it was fun, though simplistic. I paused it for a moment, and when I tried to unpause it was frozen again. Restart, play, freeze, restart, play, freeze. I did it on purpose a few times just to see if what I thought was happening was happening: you've got about a 50% chance of the game freezing up on you whenever you pause it. Then it takes two more restarts to get back in. And the cutscenes weren't skipabble either, though this may've been because the game was counting this as my 'first time through' because it didn't autosave. I finally made it to a save point (do games even still have these?) and, just like on the pause menu, it crashed.   Not only this, but nowhere does the game state that it has absolutely NO mouse support. It's a simplistic enough game, but not being able to implement such an easily accessible and vital feature reeks of either laziness or incompetence. It's prety much a direct console port with little to no care put into it.   It was a mistake buying this on release, I really should've waited for a sale a couple months from now, but my excitement really got the better of me. I'm going to be refunding Jurassic World immediately.

I have always loved the LEGO games, and even though the formula has remained largely the same over the years they are still extremely enjoyable to me. The LEGO games have benefited in recent years from a move towards open world hubs and actual dialogue. While LEGO Jurassic world has these elements and even lets you play as the dinosaurs; I am unable to progress past the second level due to a glitch that quits the game when I try to charge as the trike. All in all a fun addition to the LEGO franchise, but largely unplayable a this point. I would recommend waiting until they release some patches.

I love This Game Ive watched every movie that came out even the New one and this Game is just Awesome only one thing when i come at the tryceratops part and i want to attack with him my game crashes maybe its becouse of the just been Realesed thing but this Game is for me a 8/ 10 reallly Good story only sad about thoze many crashes :(
when i have to save timmy from the tree my game crashes ;/ Not sure why but if someone has an idea why that could help. i would greatly apprectiate it :D
Great fun, love the game as much as the films, do recommend

A fun lego game that is the best in the series so far. Contains all movies, but the open world is like hubs. Very thought out, and lots of vehicles/dinosaurs to discover. the open world is small, which makes it fast to 100% everything. 10/10 still.

I originally thought this game was only going to be based on the last movie, but it has 5 levels for each of the 4 Jurassic movies. Game was fun and like all lego games very addictive, to earn all those steam achievements.

Maybe one of the best if not the best lego game but there are some bugs with one dinosaur the raptors have trouble climing when you need them too if they fixed that bug then this game would be perfect
The graphics are pretty good.
Ellie Satler dived into a heap of dung, retrieved a lolly pop then proceeded to feed it to a sick Triceratops. 10/10 would go dung-diving again.

So far, enjoyable. I've not ran into any of the bugs/lvl stopping things that have prevented me from continuing that others have reported. I was a bit disappointed at first at the game length (I finished the first main story in less than 5hrs, The Hobbit took me 12hrs not including free play) but then saw the Lost Worlds sign near the Helicopter to continue on with the next main story. The game is $44 (Although, I got it on sale) so I'd definitely expect more than 5hrs of game play for that price tag, nice to see it was just me not be observant and not a lack of game play time to be had.

It's not bad, but I have to take some points off for the fact that it changes the story too much.   IN THE FACT THAT NO ONE DIES IN A JURASSIC PARK GAME.  However, the gameplay itself is great, and it takes me back to some of the older Lego games like Harry Potter, Star Wars, and Indiana Jones.   9/10

I bought this game to play with my son and the games have great potential to be an exellent co-op game for me and him. But it just makes us mad. If it's not crashing to windows it freezes. This game is broken!  I would not recommend any one to buy this BROKEN game!

As of right now I just find the game to buggy to give it a thumbs up. Between bugs and saves getting corrupted, I would only buy the game when it is on sale. But until some things can be patched I would not recommend this game.

They've done a new thing with this LEGO game. They've clipped audio portions straight from the movie to give the legos voices in various places. Which wouldnt be too terrible, BUT they did no editing with these clips at all. so It makes you cringe every time a lego guy starts a dialog that has a grainy background noise to it because they had to boost the gain so you could hear it clearly. it's absolutely terrible.

Ahhhh... Well, this pains me to do as it's two things I love. Love the Lego games, love the Jurassic Park films. But this game, my god this game. Bug mania and lazy, very very VERY lazy. Not only is there only about 4 levels to a film but just like everything else at the minute it's just yet another game that half arses the actual games and fills in the other three quaters with useless crap to run around collecting. It's just a bad, bad game. BAD Lego Jurassic World! DOWN! They haven't even recorded their own script they just cut the audio from the film. It's just, it's bad. Boring. Lazy. Absolutely no effort went into this, I fear for the future of these games. It unsettles me more that the next one is The Avengers. And it's just packed with stupid, unimportant, unnecerssary characters. Like Velociraptor handler, Jeep Driver and many more stupid things like that. Just bad... Bad.
i got all the way to the jurassic world movie part then it bugged out tried to reload it now everytime i go in to it it crashes. good game till now cant even play it
During the credits you run around as a T-Rex Destroying stuff collecting studs whats not to love?  10/10 would play those credits again!

to much button pressing and timing its so ragin i almost killed my computer its fun to play the story line and the gameplay quality 5/10 kinda recomend it i recomend it for them that can type fast and can react fast with the timing

I really wish there was a third option for the reviews, a meh, rather than a recommend or don't recommend.   If you like the lego games, you'll likely enjoy Lego Jurassic World. It doesn't change the formula in the slightest. This has its upsides and its downsides because of it.   Pros: Classic Lego gameplay. You break stuff, you collect studs, you build things, you solve rudementary puzzles, it's all the classic lego games, just with a jurassic park skin.  Stories are handled rather well. They (mostly) keep true to the stories, they're presented in a fun way, it's well done.  Classic Lego humor is back. Lego Marvel was lacking a lot of the classic lego slapstick, this has brought it back. Characters do silly things, there are plenty of visual gags to laugh at.  You get to play as dinosaurs (some of them, see cons for an explaination)    Cons: Let's get the big one out of the way, it's glitchy. This is the glitchiest Lego game I've ever played. There are puzzles that require raptors to jump on certain things. I believe there are 5 times you have to do this in the story. Of the 5 times I tried it, 4 had the raptors getting stuck in midair. Waiting about 30 seconds finished the animation and I thankfully didn't have to restart any of the levels, but I was dreading each time I'd have to do the raptor jump to progress the game. I've also had issues with characters getting stuck on objects, compies not being able to get out of tubes, animations glitching out. It's a glitchy game. I personally didn't have any gamebreaking glitches, but the ones I experienced certainly had the potential to be gamebreaking.  The voice acting. This is a problem I've had with every lego game since they started with it in Lego Lord of the Rings. I don't like the voice acting in lego games to begin with, it works much better in games like Lego Star Wars where the stories are told purely visually. Lego Jurassic World is the worst of the worst when it comes to voice acting. Like in the lord of the rings, they decided to use clips of audio taken directly from the movies. I'm not sure if they were aware of this while making hte game, but sound quality in movies from the 1990s wasn't exactly very good. It's even more apparent when there are background npcs that have freshly recorded lines form the 2010s. The difference is instantly noticable, and it's really really badly done.   Strangly anti-death. In a video game series full of comedic violence and cartoonish death scenes, it's strange to see the lego games go so anti-death with Jurassic Park. No one dies in the game. All the people that get eaten don't actually die. They either get tickled by raptors, or if they do get eaten by a T-Rex, they are vomited out by the end, totally unharmed. It's very unusually that they'd be this anti-death with such a death filled movie in a series of games that has never been shy about death. Very strange.  Honestly, it's kind of boring. The other lego games typically had action based characters, Jedi, Super heroes, Indiana Jones, Magic. Characters that get into combat based situations, that have special powers, interesting things like this. Jurassic Park consists of people running away and screaming. Aside from the main characters, no one is really memorable. There are a ton of characters to unlock, and only about 15 that you'll actually know. The unique and cool 'powers' these characters have consist of screaming to break glass, but only sometimes, and that's really about it. All of the other powers have already been explored in other lego games, girls jump higher (which makes no sense but whatever), kids can climb in ducts, people with guns can shoot things, ect.     Lego Jurassic World may well be the first lego game that I have no interest in 100%ing. I've beaten the story and it's honestly too boring to bother getting the minikits, gold bricks, red bricks and unlocking the other characters. The level structure, not to mention the hub world, are so either dull or poorly made that I just don't want to bother.
WHO EVER MADE IT DOESNT WORK DUMBY
This game made me feel like i was in the 90's and early 2000's when good movies were good and they were getting good none of this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ adam sandler ♥♥♥♥. btw rule 34 dinosaurs.
havent even played the game because its crashes before i even get to the loadinbg screen... so thanks. dont buy.

Pure garbage. I'd like to play this game. I have an i7 and a gtx970 running win10. But unfortunately, I can't play this game. Stuttering and freezing very badly every 10 seconds or so. Turning down to low settings doesn't help. I can play GTAV on Ultra settings but can't play this stupid game on low settings. What a rip off. Companies shouldn't be allowed to release such buggy garbage and get away with it.

I tried to use my nvidia sheild controller instead of my keyboard. When I started playing, player 2 was occupied by an unknown device. I later figured out that it was my keyboard. So I tried to unplug my keyboard and play, it still didnt work. I then tried to drop out using the keyboard, it did not have that option, I tried using both players as the keyboard and it still wouldn't let me drop out on player 2. I do not recommend buying this game currently, because the keyboard controls are completely absurd and it always adds another player when you try to use an external controller

I think that this game has enormous potential. The different challenges that the crew meets and the things they have to do to get to the next step make it fun and interesting. We bought this game for the PC and have had unfortunately nothing but problems. Trying to use the keys on the key pad to get characters to jump and move is very difficult. We have gotten stuck in certain areas where we could not move the characters and had to start over. It has been very frustrating for my ten year old son who really just wanted the free play mode and the ability to do stuff with the dinosaurs. The fact that you have to solve the whole game to do that is too daunting for him as there are basically no tips or clues for how to get unstuck in PC mode. Yes we have seen walk throughs for each part (mostly with the Xbox) and there aren't really any tips specific to the PC and how to really get the charcters to get through each area. If there were no cheats this would virtually take forever to figure stuff out. Maybe some gamers want that but it was just too frustraing for us. I do not recommend getting this on the PC but I do recommend the game.
Great Game, I really recommend it. The HUBs are AWESOME!!!!

I have already played 4hrs but Ik that I still have loads of story left. This game is amazing. I would advise using a controllor also do buy it here even if it is 24 euro or whatever it costs in other currencys but it is better to buy it here then for consoles because it costs 30 more for consoles. I have found no glitches atm so I dont think ill find any by now :D Also I looked at the ad after playing a good few levels and I feel like this will be a good game for everyone that wont just end in like 1 day.

BTW: If you're not at all interested in lego but your interested in lego but you're interrested in jurassic park this game is still great for you!

I love the nostalgia behind the game! It really conveyed the point of all four movies. I've always been a fan of Lego games, and adding the ability to play as dinosaurs was awesome! There were some scenes I was sad they didn't include, but overall it was still a great game. The audio sounded a little weird in the first movie(which I know they did their best). Note that camera angles are not the best. If you are a fan of dinosaurs, Lego games, or puzzle games in general, get this game!

PC SPECS: Radeon r7 260x 8GB ddr3 ram AMD A10-7850k  =================== Over the weekend I took a trip to the newly released 'Jurassic World' movie. I really really enjoyed the movie so I bought the game to relive the movie. Let me say I loved the original Jurassic Park movies and I really thought Jurassic World was incredible. I launched up the game with no issues. I have played for about 40 minutes and have had no problems, Graphics look great for a Lego Game. Voice acting is a bit weird, sounded like they only got Chris Pratt to re-voice act and everyone else was taken right from the movie. I am really enjoying the game and I will re-edit this post when I finish the game! I fully reccomend the game at this point and give it a 8/8 on my scale.
A nice relaxing game not a lot of thinking involved.If your day is boring thats a nice game to fix your day with
good game but please fix bug with the charging trike, it really upsets me :(

Game is very fun but has bugs that really need fixed, especially the 'Raptor Rail' bug, which literally halts progress and makes it impossible to continue. Other glitches (such as disappearing T-Rex and Spinosarus in their respective chase scenes, getting stuck in/on ledges, etc.) are also a nusance and need fixed soon. I would recommend waiting to buy this game until they patch the bugs since there are a few game breakers right now. 9/10 Awesome game.
This game is really good, it's funny and smart, has all the movies in it, can play as SO many characters and dinosaurs! There is a lot of content and fun to be had here

TL;DR  Recommend cause: - It's LEGO - It includes all 4 Jurassic Park movies - You do not get (too many) spoilers, so you can even enjoy the movies after playing the game first - Collectibles and Replayability (like any LEGO game :P) - You can play as a Dinosaur xD   Like any LEGO game, I can only recommend it (okay, I admit, I wasn't too pleased with LEGO Marvel Heroes... somehow that game was more of a... drag... than enjoyment, at least for me xD).  Playing through all 4 Jurassic Park movies was pretty awesome and that combined with the typcial LEGO game humor was really fun. Though I found that 5 level per movie cut it a bit short, at first I was a bit disappointed how fast I played through a movie story, but after playing it a 2nd time, I relized it just had the right length.  Also, because of the LEGO humor they add and how the stories are cut, you can experience a basic of the Jurassic Park movies without actually getting too many spoilers for anyone who hasn't seen the movies yet, and watching them will still excite you.  The voice acting from 1-3 sounds like it was directly cut out of the movies and inserted into the game, which was a bit strange at first, but I actually like that.   They fixed some things which annoyed and frustrated me in the other LEGO games, like jumping on a small pillar to reach another point... how often I fell off and had to run up against cause my character just didn't land EXACTLY on the spot which the game wanted you or cause the camera wasn't in a good position.  Now you just have to press the jump button and the character hops from one pillar to the next, making it quite easy (some might say too easy...) but a lot less frustrating.  They added some others things which became frustrating to me at some points - like turning a handle via the analog stick on your controler (not sure what that would be like on keyboard :S). It's just unresponsive at times and even if you're circling your analog stick perfectly, it sometimes dropped the progress and you had to start again... it felt like I had to figure out a pace for each handle in which the analog stick was supposed to be turned. Some handles wanted veeeery slow circles, others you could do normally, that was very annoying.  And like any other LEGO game you have your lil glitches, which can be frustrating, but not game ruining. For example, one worker and some gold bricks were not shown on the map area to collect, in the first HUB (1st Jurassic Park).  I thought the game glitched (like in LEGO LotR) and I had to restart everything to get 100%... which I did and then I came accross that worker in my 2nd playthrough and saw it wasn't displayed on the map. Went back to my old save and look there... he was there, including 2 gold bricks. Got 100% then -.-  But like any other LEGO game from TT Games, you can expect that it will never get a patch and you just gotta live with with. (thanks TT for taking good care of your games after release... maybe something to invest money it from all the DLCs? hmmm)  Anyways, the game is still good and fun and the price okay. I just wish they'd add an online Co-op at one point, cause none of my friends play these games... they even flatout refuse to play them with me, lol

This game has that same charm that made me fall in love with the series in the first place. It has a good, familiar story to follow but puts a humorous twist on pretty much every element. It has lots of cool dinosaurs to play as and plenty of characters to unlock. I also love how the open world is set up. instead of a giant grey square city that looks and feels bland, you have linear paths around the two islands that let you explore it in detail without being overloaded with tons of filler that you woudnt have noticed anyway. This is the best open world they have ever had in a lego game, and while I have only played the campaign through, for the first time in many lego games, I am excited to get 100%. Download this game now if you like jurassic Park, or Lego games.   A quick note: this is a kids game so dont go in expecting any mentally challenging tasks like thought provoking puzzles or combat consisting of more that button mashing.

I think this game is great, there are some bugs about the game but the main bug is how the triceratops's charge exits you from the game. What i did was switch between Alan Grant and Ian Malcolm around 5 times then changed to the triceratops and walk right up to the orange crack and use the charge. It should bring up a meter to hold down. Then make sure you have talked to the guy that tells you that the rock has fallen into the way of the path. Use your ticeratops to fight of the philosoraptors and then you should be good. I love this game and I hope you love it too. Give this a thumbs up if this helped. If you have other problems with this game tell me so I can find out how to fix them.
its a really cool game, if you want to play a lego game. you should play this one, also where can i report a bug that i have?

Good for dinosaur lovers, but has many glitches. Often takes several tries to load, stutters while playing, characters fall through the map or dinosaurs (especially triceratops) get stuck. Please patch the bugs and it will be a great game!
i world like that bug from when u try turn on the power in the first one fixed i keep trying and it will just get stuck in the wall

a bug is preventing me from moving forward from the power shed and if i do get past it the dino gets to one heat nd doesnt show the aims on the bushes so i cant shoot it. it needs to be fixed but the game is good so far

At the core t is still just one more lego game: You play through the story, unlock characters, vehicles, minikits, blocks and all that jazz. Oh yes and there are dinosauruses mixed in. For a jurassic park fan this'll be a blast, but sometimes the story skips a bit and might feel a tad confusing if the movies are not fresh in your mind.   Some improvements have been made since Marvel. (I haven't played Batman and refuse to play Hobbit since it is unfinished, so I can't really comment on any improvements regarding those titles.) Many stages allow loads of backtracking and in Free Play you can start from any checkpoint, which is HUGE when trying to find those last pesky minikits. Also The Hub is interesting and well thought.   In the end it is basically the same concept as any other lego game. But that is not a bad thing in my book.  Just be aware that people are reporting bugs. In my 100% playthrough I once fell through the world (but respawned quickly after that) and once a character just kept running to a wall and did not respond to the controls. Other than that I had no big problems.
I love the movies and i love this game,wish that certain glitches wouldnt happen that stop me from finishing certain levels but what can ya do

Honestly, I was having a lot of fun with this game, but there are too many bugs to be able to enjoy it... Im sure some of you have experienced the same bugs i have, such as the worker on the crane staying asleep instead of falling like hes supposed to, and being unable to build the panel to turn on the power in the park in the 'Restoring Power' level.. These bugs will not let you progress with the game...Id like to be able to play a game without having to change some settings to avoid bugs. Save your money until the bugs are patched. Im a huge fan of other lego games, but i was really disappointed with this one.

Until this game is fixed, I cannot recomend it. There are a handful of bugs, particularly on low-end computers, that completely block progress. Come on guys, I know you guys can do better. After all, some of the glitches are issues with triggering (game design speak) and, frankly, it's the result of sloppy coding/design.  For Pete's sake, at least address the issue that you should be well aware of after 3 weeks of the game on the market.  The worst partl; when it works the game is actually pretty good. I love the humor and the level design as a whole. Not to mention, it is fun to just find out how they made some of the stuff from the movie family friendly.  Long story short; be ready to get a refund if they haven't released a patch by the time you (the potential consumer) reads this.
i like the idea about the game and its a beautiful game but it has simply to many bugs

When I bought this, I thought it was just the fourth movie made LEGO, boy was I ever in for a (plesant) surprise! They seem to have fixed a lot of the problems I had with controls and game play in the earlier LEGO games making everything a lot smoother. Granted, I'm more of a casual player and this is easy to pick up controls and where I left off.  Definitely recommend this game! Also: bous points for being able to play a character with my name :D
Amazing game, but my game is stuck on the loading screen. Does it reload the entire world when i do something?

Although this game is very fun as all lego videogames are I dont recommend the PC version. The reason is that this version houses many glitches that can make it deemed unplayable. One major glitch I ran into is in the chapter The Raptor Pack when fighting the raptor. During the battle the red signs that allow you to throw an object dont appear meaning you cant even beat the raptor and finish the chapter. I have had to reset my game numerous times meaning I have to play the entire chapter over again. I recommend buying this game on a console so you do not run into any glitches.   EDIT: I finally got past the raptor fight and now I am AGAIN stuck on ANOTHER chapter. After countless tries during the trex and raptor fight I got the controls. Now I cant figure how the ♥♥♥♥ your supposed to shake the raptor back in forth... I tried many buttons including A and D, and the left and right arrows finally I got so mad I spammed buttons and still nothing happened. Again dont play this game on PC it is downright terrible...

This game is amazing! i have hardly any lag with it, i thought i would get a lot more lag but i didnt. Sometimes i can just listen to the peaceful music and explore as a dinosaur in the park. i recomend this to all players out there 10/10 good job LEGO!

!st time review...  This is in my opinion the best lego game to date, the next in line would be mrvel. the expansive content in this is a standout, free roam through out all of the jurrassic park movies, in any vehicle of your choice, unlocking dinosaurs and charicters, exploring the island for lego peices to make your own dinosaur. With this many options it feels like this lego game has set the standard for any future movie tie in games. A MUST HAVE!  SCORE: 9/10  only reason i dont rate this 10 is a few wonky moments trying to line up the button icons to interact with the environment, besides that nothing else to highlight.  Not only does it feel like i am an adult playing with his lego again it also brings me back to being a kid and watching the movies for the first time,  tryuly a instand classic for me :P Thanks

PLEASE FIX THE BUGS, GLICTHES AND CRASHES IN THIS GAME. Yes, I would recommend this game. But the developers really need to fix the in game crashes and bugs! I know a lot of people who have these problems that own this game.  This is a fun game so far but the game either crashes when you start it up or in game. 100% competed the game. This games does many things right, and improves greatly on LEGO games.  Pros: - The game looks more polished than previous LEGO games. - Dinosaurs - 100+ LEGO figurines to collect - 20+ cars to unlock - Dinosaurs - Handles the deaths of the characters in a very child friendly way. - LEGO humor EVERYWHERE - Did I say dinosaurs?  Cons - Jump cuts from the movies arn't very fluent - Some users find many bugs, but I did not find any.  This review is pretty half baked, but I would reccomend this to anybody interested to dinosaurs and LEGO games.

Lego games used to be fun. Star Wars, I wanted to complete every single level. I couldn't wait for the next one. Lego Indiana Jones was okay, too. Lego Lord of the Rings and Lego the Hobbit were pushing it, I started getting annoyed at the minikits and gold bricks. Lego Movie, I just want to complete it to see how the story ends. This game? I'm pushing myself for every inch of ground, every level that goes past, just trying to get to the end so I can do free play and explore as whoever I want. It's so aggravating! QTEs that punish you for even a millisecond's hesitation, but mix the buttons up so to pass them you have to pause the game repeatedly - which ruins the animation. Wandering around aimlessly for level after level trying to figure out what it wants you to do, only to find it was that one little thing tucked in a corner. Running and driving away from dinosaurs without the slightest hint of how to avoid getting hit - turns out you have to shoot chickens into their mouths when they roar. Which means you have to switch the second it looks like they're about to roar. I can honestly say I hate lego games right now. I hope the endgame is worth it, because I'm seven hours in, two and a quarter movies down and I don't want to finish the last two. Half an hour in the last week gives you a hint at how much I really don't want to play the poorly designed story missions. And if the end of this is one massive open world where you just constantly run around looking for secrets and amber I'm going to quit Lego games forever.
Great game! Although I think it's a little to easy.

I bought this for my brother for his birthday. Us older people that may play this game will be pleased to know that they actually have Jurassic Park with this game! You get to relive scenes from the first movie! Besides hitting us in the nostalgia though, I get irked by how the map in this game works. They don't make it clear, in my opinion, where your goal actually is. Compared to the Jurassic World portions of the game, the Jurassic Park portion definitely feels slapped together when your eyes aren't blinded with nostalgia. 3/5 for me.
after 16 hours of playtime, my save file is now corrupted... thats the last i'll play of this game.

Ive been playing lego games since lego island AGES ago and this one is pretty decent. For an open world sort of thing its pretty big and full of content, granted its a LOT easier than in the old games. It seems the more games lego pumps out the easier they get, less puzzles more cutscenes. Still got the lego game humor albeit a little TOO much at times. This may be just because I am not a kid anymore but it would be nice to see it a little more serious. Even lego star wars was more serious than this and the jurassic series has giant lizard birds eating people but they censor it too death for kids even though lego star wars had implied decapitations and people getting blown apart or shot to death.
This Is Really Great LEGO Game ! Dinosuars ! Damn ! You Guys Have To Buy This If You're LEGO Games Fan !  Score : 9.5/10 Cuz It's Have a Little Failed xD
good game plenty to do

Fun game, the best part of the game is after you beat all of the levels and are just exploring the parks and islands. But its missing the classic lego style violence from games like lego star wars. Which was disapointing...

I got this game to play with my wife. She was really into SNES and Genesis as a kid all the way until Halo on the original XBox, but since then she sort of backed out of gaming. We are both huge Jurassic Park fans and I thought this would be a fun game to play together. So glad I got it. It's been a while since I have been able to play a game with my wife where we lose track of time and need to make ourselves turn it off.  The game is surprisingly all movies in the franchise. In the begenning you get to play wither Jurassic Park 1 or Jurassic World. After beating JP1, you unlock JP2! Very excited when that happened!   The game plays like most Lego games, and borrows all audio from the movies (at least in the cases of JP1 & JP2) and for a huge JP fan, this is actually a plus. They stick the films rather well and but with a light hearted twist. You'll see what I mean during the 'SHOOT HER!!' scene.  I have no problem buying this at full price. I have nearly every Lego game on steam and wouldn't pay more than 10 for all the others. This is the best Lego game I have played so far.
I liked the Jurassic Park trilogy and Jurassic World, and this game was great.

Great Game Just the same old lego formula and thats not bad. As someone who has loved lego games and owns almost all of them. Lego Jurassic world is a great game. Everything has been streamlined to make everything easier to do best lego game in ages. Getting 100% is the true challenge and the reason to play. The first lego game since Lego City I have enjoyed and hasen't felt like a chore.
This game is crap... In the intro level I got the machine/car sweeper stuck on a wall. I did this multiple times. I think this should be a 'Free to Play' game.

It's pretty good.  The controls as ever are hard to get used to on a PC keyboard.  The humour is well timed and suitable.  It's a lego game, they're all pretty much the same, which is a good thing.  I'm using a GTX960 running Windows 10 and not having any problems. :)

Lego Jurassic World is a very good lego game. It is everything that you can expect from lego games and doesnt offer much in innovation, but for fans of the jurassic park franchise or of lego games you will surely be pleased with your purcahse. Would not recommend buying for full price as lego games are constanly on sale. Good for all ages and with the characters talking now it makes the games more true to the movies. Personally took me about 25 hours to 100% the game so has value in play time and can keep a person invested for quite a while.
